content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

```julia
function extract_julia_code(md::String)
    # Regular expression to match Julia code blocks in Markdown
    code_block_pattern = r"^ *```julia[^{]*```"m
    fenced_code_blocks = split(md, "\n") |> collect |> filter(x -> occursin(code_block_pattern, x))

    # Remove code fences from each block
    code_blocks = fenced_code_blocks |> map(x -> replace(x, code_block_pattern => ""))

    # Join the code blocks together with a newline
    joined_code = join(code_blocks, "\n")

    return joined_code
end
```

This function works by first splitting the Markdown document into lines and then filtering out those that do not contain Julia code blocks using a regular expression. It then removes the code fences from each block and joins them together with a newline.
